nodes.text: An e-nursery retail website that integrates clustering-based recommendation algorithms and visual data representation will enhance user experience and optimize business operations for plant nurseries and customers
The proposed web platform includes a curated catalog of plant species, detailed descriptions and care guides, customer reviews, and an intuitive user interface to facilitate browsing and shopping

Data gathering methods: build a plant database with attributes (growth patterns, light and water requirements, pricing), collect customer registration data (demographics, purchase history, search activity), and collect product feedback (reviews and ratings)

Recommendation system method: prepare and clean customer and interaction data, apply clustering algorithms (e.g., K-means or hierarchical clustering) to group similar users, and generate product suggestions based on cluster membership and past behavior

Visual data representation method: integrate the project database with Tableau for interactive dashboards and use Matplotlib for programmatic visualizations to display sales trends, customer demographics, and product popularity
Implemented web features include secure login and registration pages, home page navigation, add-to-cart functionality, checkout flow, payment gateway integration, and transaction receipts
An implemented personalized recommendations page demonstrated a recommendation example where a user who added Piper Betel Maghal received Aloe vera as a suggested plant
Clustering algorithms can group users by preferences and behaviors to support personalized product suggestions based on cluster membership

Prior literature supports use of K-means, hybrid clustering, collaborative filtering, and deep embedding techniques to improve recommendation accuracy and address issues like cold-start and data sparsity
The platform aims to increase accessibility for plant enthusiasts and extend market reach for nurseries by providing online discovery, price comparison, and payment facilitation

Conclusion: Integrating clustering-based recommendations and visual data representation creates a user-friendly, data-driven e-nursery that enhances shopping experience, supports informed decision-making, and provides insights for inventory and marketing

Limitation: The project report mainly presents system design, interfaces, and illustrative recommendation examples but lacks quantitative evaluation metrics (accuracy, precision, recall) and user study results to validate recommendation effectiveness
E-commerce operational methods included implementing secure payment gateway integration and shopping cart features with real-time product availability to avoid out-of-stock purchases
